list_definition.definition: a framework of iron bars for holding a fire in a fireplace.
to rub (cheese, vegetables etc) into small pieces by means of a grater

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Roughly grate the onion and squeeze out any excess juice.

list_ex_of_english: Before we describe other stimuli, it is important to point out potential artifacts that could contaminate the spot and grating data at high speeds.
Because the group velocity dispersion of the grating leads to substantial temporal broadening of the harmonic pulses, the time resolution was limited to several picoseconds.
The visual acuity of octopuses for grating of different orientations.
The effective spatial frequency presented to the eye was varied by moving the grating up and down above the eye.
Schematic diagram of the effect of off-axis grating orientation on the frequency of intersections of the grating with a thin-line process.
The grating pair was separated horizontally by a 30-inch gap.
The effects of grating area and spatial frequency on contrast sensitivity as a function of light level.
If the two gratings are in phase, the resulting combination is a stronger stimulus than either grating alone.
